title: ‘Movie & A Martini’ set for Stamford
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 
A new independent comedy about romance and family life in the Indian-American community, "Meet the Patels," will be the "Movie & A Martini" offering at Stamford's Avon Theatre on THursday, Oct. 8. Photo: Contributed Photo A new independent comedy about romance and family life in the... ‘Movie & A Martini’ set for Stamford 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
“Meet the Patels” will be the film to watch at the Hearst “Movie & A Martini” meet-up set for Stamford on Thursday, Oct. 8. 
The independent film is a romantic comedy about Ravi Patel , an almost-30-year-old Indian-American who has to deal with a new personal triangle between the woman of his dreams and his parents. Reviewers have called the film an Indian variation on “My Big Fat Greek Wedding.” 
After purchasing tickets at the box office, the group will meet in the lobby of the Avon Theatre . There will be a discussion after the screening at a nearby watering hole. 
The event will be hosted by entertainment writer Joe Meyers , who will be gathering comments for a story in an upcoming issue of S Magazine in the four Hearst Connecticut daily newspapers. 
Avon Theatre, 272 Bedford St., Stamford, Thursday, Oct. 8, 7 p.m. $12-$7. 203-967-3660, www.avontheatre.org
